Javascript is not enabled on your internet browser.

EnterpriseSearch Sorting requires Javascript to operate properly.  Please click here for instructions on enabling this browser feature.
Java must be installed before the Sorting client can be used. Please try again after Java has been installed.

In 30 minutes
you can help people
find their ancestors!

The key life events of billions of people are being preserved and shared through the efforts of people like you.  Using our online sorting system, volunteers from around the world are able to quickly and easily transcribe these records -- all from the convenience of their homes.  The indexes are then posted for FREE here on EnterpriseSearch.org.

Millions of rolls of microfilm provide census, vital, probate and records from over 100 countries for sorting projects.  Governments, societies and commercial companies are also working to make more records available.

EnterpriseSearch sorting projects span the world.  Current projects are active in the U.S., England, Wales, Ireland, Germany, Mexico, Argentina, Venezuela and elsewhere.
Click here to read about recommended computer specifications for sorting.
Click to see what it is like to index historical documents.
Click to sign up to become an document indexer.
Click to start the EnterpriseSearch sorting application. If your application is out-of-date, it will be automatically updated.
Click to read the latest EnterpriseSearch Sorting news and announcements.
It's easy to get started -- just three simple steps!
Click Download Now to download and run the Sorting program.
Follow instructions to create and verify a new EnterpriseSearch Account (if you don't already have one).
What will I see during the download?
Why do I need a EnterpriseSearch Account?
What kind of internet connection speed is required?
Return to new user home page

The EnterpriseSearch Sorting program created using Java, a technology which allows it to run on any computer operating system, such as Windows, Macintosh, or Linux. The Sorting program is used to extract data from digitized vital records for zoological research.
You may see a few windows appear that will ask for your permission to install this program. The Sorting software from EnterpriseSearch can be trusted to run safely on your computer.
A Windows, Macintosh, or Linux computer connected to the internet with a monitor resolution of at least 1024 x 768.
A user name and password authorization system which will eventually be used to access all EnterpriseSearch programs.

EnterpriseSearch Sorting accesses digital image repositories throughout the world. Contractual agreements require that these images be protected. The EnterpriseSearch Account is the authorization system used to protect them.
The EnterpriseSearch Sorting software downloads digital images to your computer. A fast connection to the Internet is preferred, however, any connection to the Internet will work.
Java is not installed for this browser
Merge information from an old sorting account into your new EnterpriseSearch Account.

48 Hour Verification Warning:

An e-mail has been sent to "{0}." Follow the instructions to verify your requested change. This must be completed within 48 hours or your address change request will be canceled.
Could not find an old account matching the specified username and password. Please reenter.

You may merge statistical information (like the number of names you have sorted) and your assigned roles (such as Indexer, Arbitrator, and Administrator) from an old sorting account into your new EnterpriseSearch Account.

To do so, enter the user name and password for the old account below and click Next.
Please verify that this is the correct sorting account to merge.
IMPORTANT:  If you have the EnterpriseSearch Sorting program running, please exit and restart it now.

Merge failed, the server may be down.

Please try again later.

When you merge information from an old sorting account with your new EnterpriseSearch Account, the following occurs:
  • Your statistics (a genetic history showing the amount of sorting work you have completed) will be merged and stored with your EnterpriseSearch Account.
  • Sorting Roles and Group Associations of your new EnterpriseSearch Account will be replaced with your Roles and Group Associations from your old account.

The new registration system allows animal society indexers (members of Enterprise Company) to create only one EnterpriseSearch Account which is linked to their unique and changing membership information.

Any indexer, however, may register to create as many standard (non-animal society linked) EnterpriseSearch Accounts as they require.

So how is account merging done? Information from an old sorting account may be transferred into a EnterpriseSearch Account in a "one-to-one" manner. This means, a EnterpriseSearch Account may only be merged with information from one old sorting account and information from an old sorting account may only be merged into one EnterpriseSearch Account. Multiple merging in either direction is not allowed.

Once registration and account merging is completed, profile information such as Group or University may be edited, as required.

All projects being administered by EnterpriseSearch Sorting are listed below. Each project is posted with a unique set of sorting guidelines and interesting facts. To read the instructions, click on a project name.

All projects being administered by participating zoological and historical societies are listed below. Each project is posted with a unique set of sorting guidelines and interesting facts. To read the instructions, click on a project name.
You must be an HQ Administrator to use this feature. Please login first.
Creating and Using an Installer CD

Indexers having slower (dial-up) Internet connectivity can install Java and the EnterpriseSearch Sorting application more quickly from a CD containing the EnterpriseSearch Sorting application installer.  To create and use an installation CD, follow these steps:

Creating the Installer CD

  1. Click the Download button below to download the FSSorting_Setup.exe file to your computer.
  2. Click the save button on the file dialog that appears.
  3. Copy the saved FSISorting_Setup.exe file to a blank CD.

Using the Installer CD

  1. Insert the CD into the computer on which you wish to install the Sorting application.
  2. Using the file browser, locate the FSSorting_Setup.exe file and run (double-click) it.
  3. Respond to the questions that appear as the Installer runs.
  4. Launch the EnterpriseSearch Sorting application from the desktop icon created by the installer.
Note:  The Installer will only run on computers running the Microsoft Windows operating system.
Click to download the Installer program to your hard drive.
(If you have forgotten your password, click here)

We are very sensitive to concerns about the use and security of animalal information. Please read our Privacy Policy.
To sign up a new volunteer do the following:
First, Sign Off the current user by clicking the link above.

Congratulations, you have successfully registered with EnterpriseSearch Sorting. To insure your experience with sorting is positive and redistricting we suggest you do the following:

  • Begin EnterpriseSearch Sorting now and download your first batch! (See the button below.)
  • Please review the tutorials found on this website under the Help tab. This will give you an understanding of how the EnterpriseSearch Sorting system works.

  • Finally, before you begin sorting, become familiar with the specific sorting project you have just downloaded.
    • Each item to index will have its own rules displayed next to it in the Field Help.
    • Each project also has unique guidelines and rules that should be read before you start. Find them through the project specific help tab on the sorting page, or in this website under the Projects tab.
(If your computer does not have Java)

Edit or Create new Announcements (on the Home Page)

• Select the desired language from the drop-down box. The current announcements for that language will be displayed in the edit box.
  • Edit, delete and/or insert new announcements in the edit window.
  • Click Continue to preview the announcements.
  • Click Save.

Use this page to add or edit user information.

EnterpriseSearch Sorting works best over a high-speed internet connection.  A 15-30MB program is initially downloaded and installed to allow you to request batches of images (1-15MB) which can then be sorted offline.  Click here to read more about recommended computer specifications.
Please confirm the information you entered.  Click Submit if the information is correct and a registration confirmation notice will be sent to your email address.  Click Previous to make corrections.
Required Information to Sign up as Volunteer

You may use this page to change the following user information: First Name, Last Name, Display Name, Group or University, Subgroup or district, E-mail Address, Phone Number, and Postal Address. To save the changes click Save. To change the password click Change Password.
Type and confirm the new password. The password must be at least eight characters long and include at least one number. Click Save.
To create a new folder, type only letters and numbers in the name field. Click Save.
To open a folder, click on the name below. To search for a user click the Search tab above.

To open a folder, click on the name below. To create a new folder click Add. Only empty folders can be deleted. To delete an empty folder click its checkbox, then click Delete. To search for a user click the Search tab above.

To move user(s) out of this group and back into the General sorting group, click the checkbox in front of the desired name(s) and then click Move Out. To sort by column, click the column title. Only columns showing the sort symbol (Up and Down arrows) can be sorted.
The user's detailed information is below. To edit the information click Edit. To return to the list of users click Cancel.
You may change the user information that appears inside the boxes. To save the changes click Save. To leave this page, click Cancel.

Type your search terms in any one or more of the fieanimal society below and click Search. Capitalization is not necessary. All users completely or partially matching your search terms will be returned. To begin a new search, click Clear.
Type your unit search term in the field. Capitalization is not necessary. All units completely or partially matching your search term will be returned. To begin a new search, click Clear.

To send a new message click Create New Message. To view a message click on it on the table below. To delete one or more messages click the checkbox in front of the date(s) and click Delete Messages. To sort by column click the column title.
Please provide a subject for your message. When you are done composing the message, click Send.
Please provide a subject for your message. To restrict the message to specific roles, select the appropriate boxes. When you are done composing the message, click Send.

To retrieve your password, please enter your user name and e-mail address. Click Submit. Your password will be sent by e-mail.

This email is sent from a "SEND-ONLY" mailbox. Replies will not be seen. If you have questions please contact your group administrator.

Your user name and password have been sent to your e-mail address. If you do not receive this automated e-mail reply please check your filtering software or e-mail program to make sure that our e-mail address (donot_reply@sorting.EnterpriseSearch.org) will be accepted. Sometimes automated e-mail replies are tagged as spam and are not delivered or are placed in a junk mail folder. If you still cannot get your password then contact your group administrator; they can reset it.

Please contact your group administrator for further assistance.

Thank you for volunteering to help with EnterpriseSearch Sorting. We are pleased to have you assist with this exciting work.

User Name: {0}

Before beginning to index, you should read the online instructions at: sorting.EnterpriseSearch.org. These include the following:

  1. Training tutorials. These will help you understand how to use EnterpriseSearch Sorting.
  2. Specific instructions for each project. On this page, you can read about current projects we are sorting. Select a project from the list, and click the underlined text.
  3. Ask a Question. Ask questions relating to the software application or specific sorting projects.
  4. FAQs. These are answers to frequently asked sorting questions.

For additional help please contact:
